src/newtonERP/viewers/secondStep/colorViewer/ColorViewer.java

00001 package newtonERP.viewers.secondStep.colorViewer;
00002 
00003 import java.util.Hashtable;
00004 
00010 public class ColorViewer
00011 {
00012         private static Hashtable<String, String> colorMap;
00013 
00018         public static String getColor(String text)
00019         {
00020                 text = text.replaceAll("\\<.*?\\>", "");
00021                 text = text.toLowerCase();
00022 
00023                 text = text.replaceAll("[^a-z0-9]", "");
00024 
00025                 String predefinedColor = ColorViewerSpecialWordList
00026                                 .getSpecialWordColor(text);
00027 
00028                 if (predefinedColor != null)
00029                         return predefinedColor;
00030 
00031                 if (getColorMap().get(text) == null)
00032                         getColorMap().put(text, buildColor(text));
00033 
00034                 return getColorMap().get(text);
00035         }
00036 
00037         private static Hashtable<String, String> getColorMap()
00038         {
00039                 if (colorMap == null)
00040                         colorMap = new Hashtable<String, String>();
00041                 return colorMap;
00042         }
00043 
00044         private static String buildColor(String text)
00045         {
00046                 if (text.equals(""))
00047                         return "#FFF";
00048 
00049                 String hex = Integer.toHexString(text.hashCode()).toUpperCase();
00050 
00051                 while (hex.length() < 6)
00052                         hex += "0";
00053 
00054                 hex = normalizeColors(hex);
00055 
00056                 return "#" + hex.substring(0, 6);
00057         }
00058 
00059         private static String normalizeColors(String color)
00060         {
00061                 return normalizeColor(color.substring(0, 2))
00062                                 + normalizeColor(color.substring(2, 4))
00063                                 + normalizeColor(color.substring(4, 6));
00064         }
00065 
00066         private static String normalizeColor(String color)
00067         {
00068                 char firstNumber = color.charAt(0);
00069 
00070                 if (firstNumber == '0')
00071                         firstNumber = '8';
00072                 else if (firstNumber == '1')
00073                         firstNumber = '9';
00074                 else if (firstNumber == '2')
00075                         firstNumber = 'A';
00076                 else if (firstNumber == '3')
00077                         firstNumber = 'B';
00078                 else if (firstNumber == '4')
00079                         firstNumber = 'C';
00080                 else if (firstNumber == '5')
00081                         firstNumber = 'D';
00082                 else if (firstNumber == '6')
00083                         firstNumber = 'E';
00084                 else if (firstNumber == '7')
00085                         firstNumber = 'F';
00086 
00087                 return firstNumber + color.substring(1);
00088         }
00089 }
